sections.heading: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Drug School Act.
sections.text: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Drug School Act.

sections.heading: Findings; purpose.  The General Assembly finds as follows:
sections.text: Findings; purpose. The General Assembly finds as follows:

sections.heading: Definition.   As used in this Act, "drug school" means a drug intervention and education program established and administered by the State's Attorney's Office of a particular county as an alternative to traditional prosecution
sections.text: A drug school shall include, but not be limited to, the following core

sections.heading: Successful completion.
sections.text: If an individual is certified by the State's Attorney that he or she has successfully completed the terms of the drug school, the State's Attorney shall waive prosecution for the immediate offense and discharge the case.

sections.heading: Violations. Upon a violation of any of the terms of the drug school, the State's Attorney may proceed with prosecution as otherwise authorized under law
sections.text: Violations. Upon a violation of any of the terms of the drug school, the State's Attorney may proceed with prosecution as otherwise authorized under law.

sections.heading: Appropriations to the Division of Substance Use Prevention and Recovery.
sections.text: Appropriations to the Division of Substance Use Prevention and Recovery.
